intent_responses.greeting: Hey there! How can I assist you today?
intent_responses.thanks: You're welcome! Let me know if you have more questions.
intent_responses.how_are_you: I'm doing great, thanks for asking! How can I help you today?
intent_responses.bot_joke: Why dont scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything!
intent_responses.bot_favorite_color: I'd say Blue  like the vibrant BAU campus color!
intent_responses.bot_creator: I was created by Nneka, to help students like you!
intent_responses.bot_identity: I'm Azalea, your BAU campus guide chatbot, here to make your life at school easier!
intent_responses.bot_capabilities: I can answer your questions about BAU, guide you around the campus, and assist with important information like registration, fees, schedules, or lead you to the right source.
intent_responses.hostel_application: To apply for hostel accommodation, visit the student affairs office or apply online via the housing portal. Make sure youve completed enrollment.
intent_responses.grading_system: Grades are based on both absolute and relative evaluation. Letter grades range from A (4.00) to F (0.00). Minimum for pass is typically D or C depending on course type. Final exams must account for at least 40% of the total score.
intent_responses.libary_location: The libary is located on the 4th floor of the B-Block building, There's an elevator in the building that you can use.
intent_responses.hall_location: The Conference Hall is located on the 4th floor of the B-Block building, There's an elevator in the building that you can use.
intent_responses.registration_office: The registrars office is located on the 1st floor of the main admin building, opposite the student affairs office. Open 9AM5PM weekdays.
intent_responses.academic_calendar: To get accurate information on this you should view the full academic calendar https://baucyprus.edu.tr/academic-calendar/. It includes semester dates, breaks, and key deadlines.
intent_responses.ois_portal: You can access your OIS portal at https://ois.baucyprus.edu.tr/auth/login. Use your username and password to log in.
intent_responses.school_debts: To check your school debts or fee balance, go to the Finance tab in your OIS portal or contact the bursary.
intent_responses.it_office: The IT office is located in on the ground floor at the B-Block of the Admin Block. They handle student emails, portal access, and technical issues.
intent_responses.oin_status: . You can verify your if your student card is ready at the registration office.
intent_responses.login_help: You can reset your password via the OIS login page. Click 'Forgot Password' and follow the instructions.
intent_responses.cafeteria_hours: The BAU Gastro cafeteria usually opens at 8:00 Am and  closes around 7:00 PM. Hours may vary on weekends or holidays.
intent_responses.scholarship_info: Scholarship eligibility is based on GPA, financial need, and program. Visit the scholarships page on the BAU website.If you Qualify, then visit the Dean at the student affairs office
intent_responses.financial_info: Log into your OIS portal and click on the third icon and go to 'Financial Information' to view your fee statements and balances.
intent_responses.cyprus_lifestyle: Cyprus offers a vibrant student life, beautiful beaches, local restaurants, and cultural events in Cyprus.
intent_responses.bus_schedule: Bus schedules are posted on the Bau Instagram page, you can check for it on the Instagram story too and are also available at the security office.
intent_responses.universal_income: This is a broader economic question. For now, no policy on universal income is being implemented at BAU.
intent_responses.internship_policy: Internships are mandatory for many programs. Students must secure their placement, fill insurance and evaluation forms, and submit internship reports. Failure to submit on time may result in failing the internship.
intent_responses.transfer_exemption: Transfer and exemption procedures require submitting transcripts, course descriptions, and a formal petition to the registration office. Courses must match at least 70% in content and credits to be eligible.
intent_responses.graduate_regulations: Graduate programs require a bachelor's degree, sometimes ALES, GPA  3.0, and may include thesis or non-thesis options. Thesis tracks involve 120240 ECTS, defense, and committee evaluation.
intent_responses.bau_info: BAU stands for Baheehir Cyprus University. It's a private higher education institution located in Nicosia, Northern Cyprus. It is part of the global BAU Global network, offering undergraduate and graduate programs in English and Turkish, with a focus on international standards, academic excellence, and innovation. You can follow the link to visit the school website and learn more https://baucyprus.edu.tr/
intent_responses.undergrad_duration: Undergraduate programs typically last 4 years. However, some programs may be 5 or 6 years. Maximum allowed duration is 79 years depending on the program.
intent_responses.tuition_fees: Tuition is set annually by the Board of Trustees. Fees vary by program and student status. Payments can be made in full or installments. Financial obligations must be met to complete enrollment.
intent_responses.school_internship_policy: According to the school, internships are mandatory for graduation in many programs. Students must complete their internships at approved institutions and submit the necessary reports.
intent_responses.school_graduate_admission: The school requires a bachelor's degree and sometimes an entrance exam for graduate admission. Language proficiency may also be required.
intent_responses.school_transfer_process: Students transferring must provide transcripts and course details. Transfers are subject to the schools approval based on course equivalence.
intent_responses.school_grading_policy: The school uses a standard grading scale with letter grades and a GPA system. Passing grades typically start from D or C depending on the course.
intent_responses.school_tuition_information: Tuition fees are set annually by the school. Installment plans are available, and payment schedules must be followed to stay enrolled.
intent_responses.school_language_requirement: The school requires English proficiency demonstrated through tests like IELTS or TOEFL. Students may also enroll in a preparatory program.
intent_responses.school_course_registration: Course registration is done online through the school's system. Students must register during the announced enrollment period.
intent_responses.school_academic_calendar: The academic calendar includes start and end dates for semesters, holidays, and examination periods. It is published by the school every year.
intent_responses.school_attendance_policy: Students are required to attend at least 70% of their classes. Missing too many classes can result in failing the course.
intent_responses.school_exam_regulations: Each course requires at least one midterm and one final exam. Students must adhere to the exam schedules and policies set by the school.
intent_responses.school_dropout_policy: Students can drop out by following the official withdrawal process. Consequences include loss of student privileges and fees depending on withdrawal timing.
intent_responses.school_readmission_process: Students who dropped out can apply for readmission by submitting a new application and fulfilling any outstanding requirements.
intent_responses.school_library_services: The school library offers book loans, study spaces, and online resources. Students need their ID card to access services.
intent_responses.school_housing_options: Student housing options include on-campus dormitories and partnerships with nearby housing providers. Applications are handled through the housing office.
intent_responses.school_scholarship_information: Scholarships are available for students based on academic merit and financial need. Applications typically open before the start of the academic year.
intent_responses.school_health_services: The school provides healthcare services through an on-campus clinic. Counseling and mental health support are also available.
intent_responses.school_transportation: Transportation services include shuttle buses and student parking areas. Bus schedules are posted on school Instagram page https://www.instagram.com/p/DGDH6aWIqmQ/?img_index=3&igsh=MXRwbHEwejJscmVjaQ==.
intent_responses.school_student_affairs: Student Affairs supports students with academic, social, and welfare services. They assist with student activities and personal development.
intent_responses.school_orientation_program: Orientation programs welcome new students and provide information about school life, resources, and academic expectations.
intent_responses.school_alumni_network: The alumni network connects graduates and organizes events, mentorships, and professional development opportunities.
intent_responses.school_undergraduate_duration: Undergraduate programs at the school typically last 4 years. Some programs may extend depending on field of study.You can speak to the International Office findout more.
intent_responses.school_masters_duration: Master's programs usually require 2 to 3 years for completion depending on the type of program. You can speak to the International Office findout more.
intent_responses.school_phd_duration: PhD programs generally take 4 to 6 years to complete, with a maximum duration depending on the program.
intent_responses.school_thesis_requirements_masters: Master's students in thesis programs must complete a thesis to graduate.
intent_responses.school_thesis_requirements_phd: PhD students are required to submit and defend a thesis for graduation.
intent_responses.school_ects_masters: Master's programs require students to complete 90-120 ECTS depending on the track (non-thesis or thesis).
intent_responses.school_ects_phd: PhD programs require completion of 240 to 300 ECTS based on the student's prior qualifications.
intent_responses.school_vertical_transfer: Vertical transfers are allowed from associate to undergraduate programs subject to specific requirements.
intent_responses.school_credit_transfer_conditions: Credits can be transferred if they match at least 70% of the course content and workload.
intent_responses.school_exemption_exam: Students may be eligible for exemption exams to skip specific courses based on proficiency.
intent_responses.school_course_repetition: Students can repeat failed courses or retake to improve grades according to school policies.
intent_responses.school_internship_duration_undergraduate: Undergraduate internships must meet the required hours defined by the faculty curriculum.
intent_responses.school_internship_submission: Internship documents and reports must be submitted within 4 weeks after completing the internship.
intent_responses.school_graduation_GPA_undergraduate: A minimum GPA of 2.00 is generally required to graduate undergraduate programs.
intent_responses.school_graduation_GPA_masters: Master's students must maintain a minimum GPA of 3.00 to graduate.
intent_responses.school_graduation_GPA_phd: PhD students must maintain a GPA of at least 3.00 to be eligible for graduation.
intent_responses.school_residence_permit: International students are required to apply for a residence permit shortly after registration.
intent_responses.school_student_letter: Students can apply for a student letter by submitting a request via the school's registration office.
intent_responses.school_maximum_study_duration_undergradu: Undergraduate students must complete their studies within a maximum of 7 academic years.
intent_responses.school_maximum_study_duration_masters: Master's students must complete their degree within 6 academic semesters for non-thesis and 8 for thesis programs.
intent_responses.school_maximum_study_duration_phd: PhD students must complete their degree within 12 academic semesters.
intent_responses.school_course_load_undergraduate: Undergraduate students can register for a maximum of 40 ECTS per semester, with special permission for more.
intent_responses.school_course_load_masters: Master's students generally register for 30 ECTS credits per semester.
intent_responses.school_course_load_phd: PhD students can enroll in up to 30 ECTS per semester during coursework stage.
intent_responses.school_admission_GPA_undergraduate: A minimum high school GPA equivalent of 60% is typically required for undergraduate admissions.
intent_responses.school_admission_GPA_masters: Master's programs usually require a minimum GPA of 2.50 out of 4.00 for admission.
intent_responses.school_admission_GPA_phd: PhD applicants must generally have a master's GPA of 3.00 or above.
intent_responses.school_language_proficiency_masters: Master's students must prove English proficiency with tests like TOEFL or IELTS.
intent_responses.school_language_proficiency_phd: PhD candidates must meet English language requirements through recognized exams or preparatory programs.
intent_responses.school_admission_language_exams: The school accepts English proficiency exams like TOEFL and IELTS for admission into various programs. Specific score requirements depend on the program.
intent_responses.school_admission_language_requirements_u: Undergraduate applicants must provide proof of English proficiency through recognized exams or pass the schools English exam if required.
intent_responses.school_non_thesis_masters: The school offers non-thesis master's programs which focus more on coursework rather than research.
intent_responses.school_mandatory_attendance: Students are required to attend at least 70% of classes. Falling below this may lead to course failure.
intent_responses.school_midterm_exam_weight: Midterm exams generally contribute around 40% to the final course grade.
intent_responses.school_final_exam_weight: Final exams typically account for about 60% of the total course grade.
intent_responses.school_pass_grade_undergraduate: Undergraduate students must achieve a minimum grade of D to pass their courses.
intent_responses.school_pass_grade_masters: Master's students are required to score at least a C to pass their courses.
intent_responses.school_pass_grade_phd: PhD students must achieve at least a B to pass their courses.
intent_responses.school_course_withdrawal: Students must submit a withdrawal form before the deadline announced in the academic calendar to withdraw from a course.
intent_responses.school_graduation_certificate: Graduation certificates are issued after successful program completion. Students must clear any outstanding fees and submit the application to the registrar's office.
intent_responses.school_academic_advising: Academic advising helps students plan their courses and academic career. Advisors guide students on course selection and degree requirements.
intent_responses.school_graduation_honors: Graduating with honors requires achieving a high GPA, usually above 3.50. The specific GPA thresholds vary depending on the honors level.
intent_responses.school_internship_requirements_masters: Some master's programs require internships, while others may have alternative requirements such as a project or additional coursework.
intent_responses.school_course_registration_period: Course registration typically starts before the semester begins. Students should check the academic calendar for exact dates.
intent_responses.school_grading_policy_explanation: Grades are calculated based on midterm, final exams, projects, and participation. The final grade combines these weighted components.
intent_responses.school_double_major_policy: Students who meet academic performance criteria can apply for a double major by submitting a petition and fulfilling the second majors requirements.
intent_responses.school_minor_programs: The school offers minor programs that allow students to specialize in another field. Applications are typically submitted through the registrars office.
intent_responses.school_cgpa_warning_policy: Students whose CGPA falls below 2.00 receive an academic warning and must improve their GPA to avoid further penalties.
intent_responses.school_thesis_defense_phd: PhD students must defend their thesis before a committee. The process includes a presentation and answering questions from faculty members.
intent_responses.school_thesis_submission_deadline: Thesis submission deadlines are set each semester and published in the academic calendar. Late submissions may not be accepted.
intent_responses.school_scholarship_retention_policy: Students must maintain a certain GPA and fulfill academic requirements to retain their scholarships annually.
intent_responses.school_appeal_process: Students can appeal academic decisions by submitting a formal petition and supporting documents within the specified period.
intent_responses.school_student_exchange_eligibility: Eligible students for exchange programs usually must have completed at least one year of study and maintain a good academic record.
intent_responses.school_leave_of_absence: Students may apply for a leave of absence due to health, family, or other serious reasons with appropriate documentation.
intent_responses.school_makeup_exam_policy: Makeup exams are provided to students who miss exams due to valid, documented reasons, subject to approval.
intent_responses.school_library_fines: Late returns of library materials incur fines according to the number of overdue days as set by the library policy.
intent_responses.school_graduation_application: Graduation applications must be submitted online or in person before the deadline set by the academic calendar.
intent_responses.school_language_proficiency_exam_exempti: Students who have completed previous education in English or meet certain criteria may be exempted from language proficiency exams.
intent_responses.school_student_id_replacement: Lost student IDs can be replaced by submitting an application and paying the re-issuance fee at the registration office.
intent_responses.school_transcript_request: Students can request transcripts online through the academic portal or at the registrars office following payment of the required fees to the school.

To contact your advisor, scroll down in your OIS portal to the *Courses* section. Youll see your advisors name, email, and office number (maybe if provided). 
 If you still can't see your advisor's information, you should contact the registration office.
